Based on my analysis, I need to create a DataManager.kt file that will serve as a simple local storage solution. The code you provided seems to be a standalone implementation that doesn't integrate with the existing Room database system. Let me create this file:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/data/DataManager.kt
+++ app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/data/DataManager.kt
@@ -0,0 +1,88 @@
+package com.example.teacherscheduler.data
+
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Class
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Meeting
+
+object DataManager {
+    private val classes = mutableListOf<Class>()
+    private val meetings = mutableListOf<Meeting>()
+    private var nextClassId = 1L
+    private var nextMeetingId = 1L
+
+    init {
+        // Add sample data
+        addSampleData()
+    }
+
+    private fun addSampleData() {
+        addClass(Class(
+            subject = "Maths",
+            department = "ISE",
+            roomNumber = "101",
+            startTime = "10:14 am",
+            endTime = "11:08 am",
+            dayOfWeek = "Tue",
+            date = "May 13"
+        ))
+
+        addClass(Class(
+            subject = "Physics",
+            department = "Science",
+            roomNumber = "205",
+            startTime = "02:00 pm",
+            endTime = "03:30 pm",
+            dayOfWeek = "Wed",
+            date = "May 14"
+        ))
+
+        addMeeting(Meeting(
+            title = "Department Meeting",
+            withWhom = "Dr. Smith & Team",
+            location = "Conference Room A",
+            startTime = "09:00 am",
+            endTime = "10:00 am",
+            dayOfWeek = "Thu",
+            date = "May 15"
+        ))
+    }
+
+    // Class methods
+    fun addClass(classItem: Class): Long {
+        val newClass = classItem.copy(id = nextClassId++)
+        classes.add(newClass)
+        return newClass.id
+    }
+
+    fun getAllClasses(): List<Class> = classes.toList()
+
+    fun updateClass(classItem: Class) {
+        val index = classes.indexOfFirst { it.id == classItem.id }
+        if (index != -1) {
+            classes[index] = classItem
+        }
+    }
+
+    fun deleteClass(classId: Long) {
+        classes.removeAll { it.id == classId }
+    }
+
+    // Meeting methods
+    fun addMeeting(meeting: Meeting): Long {
+        val newMeeting = meeting.copy(id = nextMeetingId++)
+        meetings.add(newMeeting)
+        return newMeeting.id
+    }
+
+    fun getAllMeetings(): List<Meeting> = meetings.toList()
+
+    fun updateMeeting(meeting: Meeting) {
+        val index = meetings.indexOfFirst { it.id == meeting.id }
+        if (index != -1) {
+            meetings[index] = meeting
+        }
+    }
+
+    fun deleteMeeting(meetingId: Long) {
+        meetings.removeAll { it.id == meetingId }
+    }
+}

content.text:
I've created the DataManager.kt file as requested. This implementation provides a simple in-memory storage solution for classes and meetings in your TeacherScheduler application.

Here's what the DataManager does:

1. **In-Memory Storage**: It uses mutable lists to store Class and Meeting objects in memory.

2. **ID Management**: It maintains counters for class and meeting IDs to ensure unique identifiers.

3. **Sample Data**: It initializes with sample data for both classes and meetings.

4. **CRUD Operations**: It provides methods to:
   - Add new classes and meetings
   - Retrieve all classes and meetings
   - Update existing classes and meetings
   - Delete classes and meetings by ID

This implementation is separate from the existing Room database implementation in your project. It's a simpler alternative that doesn't require database setup or asynchronous operations.

Note that this is an in-memory solution, so data will be lost when the application is closed. If you need data persistence across app restarts, you might want to consider integrating this with the existing Room database or implementing a simple file-based storage solution.

--- app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/ui/ClassesFragment.kt
+++ app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/ui/ClassesFragment.kt
@@ -0,0 +1,133 @@
+package com.example.teacherscheduler.ui
+
+import android.app.AlertDialog
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import android.widget.EditText
+import android.widget.LinearLayout
+import android.widget.Toast
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.recyclerview.widget.LinearLayoutManager
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.R
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.data.DataManager
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.FragmentClassesBinding
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Class
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.ui.adapter.ClassAdapter
+
+class ClassesFragment : Fragment() {
+    private var _binding: FragmentClassesBinding? = null
+    private val binding get() = _binding!!
+    private lateinit var classAdapter: ClassAdapter
+
+    override fun onCreateView(
+        inflater: LayoutInflater,
+        container: ViewGroup?,
+        savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+    ): View {
+        _binding = FragmentClassesBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false)
+        return binding.root
+    }
+
+    override fun onViewCreated(view: View, savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+        super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState)
+        setupRecyclerView()
+        loadClasses()
+    }
+
+    private fun setupRecyclerView() {
+        classAdapter = ClassAdapter(
+            onItemClick = { classItem ->
+                showClassDetails(classItem)
+            },
+            onDeleteClick = { classItem ->
+                deleteClass(classItem)
+            }
+        )
+        binding.recyclerView.apply {
+            layoutManager = LinearLayoutManager(context)
+            adapter = classAdapter
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun loadClasses() {
+        val classes = DataManager.getAllClasses()
+        classAdapter.submitList(classes)
+        binding.emptyView.visibility = if (classes.isEmpty()) View.VISIBLE else View.GONE
+        binding.recyclerView.visibility = if (classes.isEmpty()) View.GONE else View.VISIBLE
+    }
+
+    fun showAddClassDialog() {
+        val dialogView = LayoutInflater.from(context).inflate(R.layout.dialog_add_class, null)
+        val subjectEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editSubject)
+        val departmentEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editDepartment)
+        val roomEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editRoom)
+        val startTimeEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editStartTime)
+        val endTimeEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editEndTime)
+        val dayEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editDay)
+        val dateEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editDate)
+
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle("Add New Class")
+            .setView(dialogView)
+            .setPositiveButton("Add") { _, _ ->
+                val newClass = Class(
+                    subject = subjectEdit.text.toString(),
+                    department = departmentEdit.text.toString(),
+                    roomNumber = roomEdit.text.toString(),
+                    startTime = startTimeEdit.text.toString(),
+                    endTime = endTimeEdit.text.toString(),
+                    dayOfWeek = dayEdit.text.toString(),
+                    date = dateEdit.text.toString()
+                )
+                if (validateClass(newClass)) {
+                    DataManager.addClass(newClass)
+                    loadClasses()
+                    Toast.makeText(context, "Class added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+                } else {
+                    Toast.makeText(context, "Please fill all fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+                }
+            }
+            .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    private fun validateClass(classItem: Class): Boolean {
+        return classItem.subject.isNotBlank() &&
+                classItem.department.isNotBlank() &&
+                classItem.roomNumber.isNotBlank() &&
+                classItem.startTime.isNotBlank() &&
+                classItem.endTime.isNotBlank()
+    }
+
+    private fun showClassDetails(classItem: Class) {
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle(classItem.subject)
+            .setMessage(
+                "Department: ${classItem.department}\n" +
+                "Room: ${classItem.roomNumber}\n" +
+                "Time: ${classItem.getFormattedDateTime()}"
+            )
+            .setPositiveButton("OK", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    private fun deleteClass(classItem: Class) {
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle("Delete Class")
+            .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${classItem.subject}?")
+            .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ ->
+                DataManager.deleteClass(classItem.id)
+                loadClasses()
+                Toast.makeText(context, "Class deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+            }
+            .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    override fun onDestroyView() {
+        super.onDestroyView()
+        _binding = null
+    }
+}

+++ app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/ui/MeetingsFragment.kt
@@ -0,0 +1,132 @@
+package com.example.teacherscheduler.ui
+
+import android.app.AlertDialog
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import android.widget.EditText
+import android.widget.Toast
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.recyclerview.widget.LinearLayoutManager
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.R
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.data.DataManager
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.FragmentMeetingsBinding
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Meeting
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.ui.adapter.MeetingAdapter
+
+class MeetingsFragment : Fragment() {
+    private var _binding: FragmentMeetingsBinding? = null
+    private val binding get() = _binding!!
+    private lateinit var meetingAdapter: MeetingAdapter
+
+    override fun onCreateView(
+        inflater: LayoutInflater,
+        container: ViewGroup?,
+        savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+    ): View {
+        _binding = FragmentMeetingsBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false)
+        return binding.root
+    }
+
+    override fun onViewCreated(view: View, savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+        super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState)
+        setupRecyclerView()
+        loadMeetings()
+    }
+
+    private fun setupRecyclerView() {
+        meetingAdapter = MeetingAdapter(
+            onItemClick = { meeting ->
+                showMeetingDetails(meeting)
+            },
+            onDeleteClick = { meeting ->
+                deleteMeeting(meeting)
+            }
+        )
+        binding.recyclerView.apply {
+            layoutManager = LinearLayoutManager(context)
+            adapter = meetingAdapter
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun loadMeetings() {
+        val meetings = DataManager.getAllMeetings()
+        meetingAdapter.submitList(meetings)
+        binding.emptyView.visibility = if (meetings.isEmpty()) View.VISIBLE else View.GONE
+        binding.recyclerView.visibility = if (meetings.isEmpty()) View.GONE else View.VISIBLE
+    }
+
+    fun showAddMeetingDialog() {
+        val dialogView = LayoutInflater.from(context).inflate(R.layout.dialog_add_meeting, null)
+        val titleEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editTitle)
+        val withWhomEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editWithWhom)
+        val locationEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editLocation)
+        val startTimeEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editStartTime)
+        val endTimeEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editEndTime)
+        val dayEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editDay)
+        val dateEdit = dialogView.findViewById<EditText>(R.id.editDate)
+
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle("Add New Meeting")
+            .setView(dialogView)
+            .setPositiveButton("Add") { _, _ ->
+                val newMeeting = Meeting(
+                    title = titleEdit.text.toString(),
+                    withWhom = withWhomEdit.text.toString(),
+                    location = locationEdit.text.toString(),
+                    startTime = startTimeEdit.text.toString(),
+                    endTime = endTimeEdit.text.toString(),
+                    dayOfWeek = dayEdit.text.toString(),
+                    date = dateEdit.text.toString()
+                )
+                if (validateMeeting(newMeeting)) {
+                    DataManager.addMeeting(newMeeting)
+                    loadMeetings()
+                    Toast.makeText(context, "Meeting added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+                } else {
+                    Toast.makeText(context, "Please fill all fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+                }
+            }
+            .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    private fun validateMeeting(meeting: Meeting): Boolean {
+        return meeting.title.isNotBlank() &&
+                meeting.withWhom.isNotBlank() &&
+                meeting.location.isNotBlank() &&
+                meeting.startTime.isNotBlank() &&
+                meeting.endTime.isNotBlank()
+    }
+
+    private fun showMeetingDetails(meeting: Meeting) {
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle(meeting.title)
+            .setMessage(
+                "With: ${meeting.withWhom}\n" +
+                "Location: ${meeting.location}\n" +
+                "Time: ${meeting.getFormattedDateTime()}"
+            )
+            .setPositiveButton("OK", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    private fun deleteMeeting(meeting: Meeting) {
+        AlertDialog.Builder(requireContext())
+            .setTitle("Delete Meeting")
+            .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${meeting.title}?")
+            .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ ->
+                DataManager.deleteMeeting(meeting.id)
+                loadMeetings()
+                Toast.makeText(context, "Meeting deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+            }
+            .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null)
+            .show()
+    }
+
+    override fun onDestroyView() {
+        super.onDestroyView()
+        _binding = null
+    }
+}

content.text: Now, we need to create the adapter classes for the UI. Let's create the ClassAdapter and MeetingAdapter in the UI adapter package:
Now, let's check if the item layout files exist and create them if needed:

Great! I've successfully created all the necessary files for your TeacherScheduler app:

1. **ClassesFragment.kt** - A fragment that displays a list of classes and allows adding, viewing details, and deleting classes.

2. **MeetingsFragment.kt** - A fragment that displays a list of meetings and allows adding, viewing details, and deleting meetings.

3. **ClassAdapter.kt** - A RecyclerView adapter for displaying class items in the ClassesFragment.

4. **MeetingAdapter.kt** - A RecyclerView adapter for displaying meeting items in the MeetingsFragment.

5. **dialog_add_class.xml** - A layout for the dialog to add a new class.

6. **dialog_add_meeting.xml** - A layout for the dialog to add a new meeting.

These components work with the DataManager.kt that we created earlier, which provides in-memory storage for classes and meetings.

The fragments implement the following functionality:
- Displaying lists of classes/meetings
- Adding new classes/meetings through dialog forms
- Viewing details of classes/meetings
- Deleting classes/meetings with confirmation

Both fragments use the ViewBinding pattern for accessing views and follow a clean architecture approach with separation of concerns.

Is there anything specific you'd like me to explain or modify about these implementations?

content.text:
Great! I've successfully implemented all the necessary components for your TeacherScheduler app:

1. **Updated the UI Adapters**:
   - Modified ClassAdapter.kt and MeetingAdapter.kt to use ViewBinding for more efficient view access.

2. **Updated the Main Activity Layout**:
   - Implemented a modern tabbed interface with a dark theme.
   - Added a TabLayout for navigation between Classes and Meetings.
   - Configured a ViewPager2 for smooth swiping between tabs.
   - Added a floating action button for adding new items.

3. **Updated Fragment Layouts**:
   - Modified fragment_classes.xml and fragment_meetings.xml to match the IDs used in the fragment classes.
   - Ensured proper display of empty states when no data is available.

4. **Added Color Resources**:
   - Added teal_500 color to the colors.xml file for the floating action button.

The app now has a cohesive, modern UI with a tabbed interface that allows users to easily switch between managing classes and meetings. The floating action button changes its function based on the current tab, allowing users to add either a new class or a new meeting.

All components are properly connected and should work together seamlessly. The DataManager provides in-memory storage for classes and meetings, while the UI components handle the display and interaction with this data.

content.text:
Great! I've made several improvements to the layout files to address the validation issues:

1. **Item Layouts (item_class.xml and item_meeting.xml)**:
   - Added `baselineAligned="false"` to the LinearLayouts to fix alignment issues
   - Replaced hardcoded text with `tools:text` for preview purposes
   - Increased the touch target size of the delete buttons to 48dp x 48dp
   - Changed `android:tint` to `app:tint` for proper tinting on ImageButtons
   - Used string resources for content descriptions

2. **Fragment Layouts (fragment_classes.xml and fragment_meetings.xml)**:
   - These were already updated with a dark theme and improved empty state handling

3. **Settings Layout (fragment_settings.xml)**:
   - Wrapped the ConstraintLayout in a ScrollView for better handling of content
   - Replaced `Switch` with `SwitchMaterial` for better Material Design compliance
   - Added proper touch target sizes (48dp height) for interactive elements
   - Limited button widths with `app:layout_constraintWidth_max="300dp"` to prevent them from being too wide
   - Used string resources for all text to support localization
   - Added proper text colors for the dark theme
   - Improved the layout structure for better accessibility

4. **String Resources**:
   - Added all necessary string resources to strings.xml for proper localization support
   - Created specific string resources for content descriptions and UI text

These changes should resolve all the layout validation issues while maintaining the functionality and improving the overall user experience of your TeacherScheduler app.

     <!-- Days of Week -->
     <string name="monday">Monday</string>

content.text:
I've successfully fixed all the layout issues in the fragment_meeting_detail.xml and fragment_add_edit_meeting.xml files. Here's a summary of the changes I made:

### For both files:
1. **Changed background color** to a dark theme (#1A1A1A)
2. **Added ScrollView** as the root element to ensure content is scrollable on smaller screens
3. **Improved text contrast** by using white (#FFFFFF) or light gray (#E6E6E6) text colors
4. **Limited width of elements** using `app:layout_constraintWidth_max` to prevent them from being too wide
5. **Replaced Switch with SwitchMaterial** for better Material Design compliance
6. **Increased touch target sizes** to 48dp height for better accessibility
7. **Used string resources** for all text to support localization

### For fragment_meeting_detail.xml:
1. **Improved text contrast** for all TextViews
2. **Positioned buttons** at the top of the screen instead of at the bottom
3. **Limited button width** to 200dp to prevent them from being too wide

### For fragment_add_edit_meeting.xml:
1. **Enhanced TextInputLayout appearance** with proper colors for the dark theme
2. **Added proper text colors** for TextInputEditText fields
3. **Improved button styling** with proper text colors and stroke colors
4. **Limited the width** of all input fields and buttons
5. **Added proper iconTint** for button icons

### Added string resources:
1. Added `select_date` for the date selection button
2. Added `to` for the time range separator
3. Added `time_placeholder` and `time_placeholder_end` for the time buttons

These changes should resolve all the layout validation issues while maintaining a consistent dark theme throughout the app. The UI now has better contrast, proper touch target sizes, and follows Material Design guidelines more closely.

--- app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/util/StringExtensions.kt
+++ app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/util/StringExtensions.kt
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+package com.example.teacherscheduler.util
+
+import java.text.SimpleDateFormat
+import java.util.Calendar
+import java.util.Locale
+
+/**
+ * Extension function to convert a time string (HH:mm) to a Calendar
+ */
+fun String.toCalendar(): Calendar {
+    val calendar = Calendar.getInstance()
+    try {
+        val parts = this.split(":")
+        if (parts.size == 2) {
+            val hour = parts[0].toInt()
+            val minute = parts[1].toInt()
+            calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour)
+            calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute)
+            calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)
+            calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)
+        }
+    } catch (e: Exception) {
+        // If parsing fails, just return the current time
+    }
+    return calendar
+}
+
+/**
+ * Extension function to convert a time string (h:mm a) to a Calendar
+ * Example: "3:00 PM" -> Calendar with hour=15, minute=0
+ */
+fun String.toCalendarFromAmPm(): Calendar {
+    val calendar = Calendar.getInstance()
+    try {
+        val format = SimpleDateFormat("h:mm a", Locale.US)
+        val date = format.parse(this)
+        if (date != null) {
+            calendar.time = date
+        }
+    } catch (e: Exception) {
+        // If parsing fails, just return the current time
+    }
+    return calendar
+}

I've fixed the MeetingAdapter.kt file by switching from view binding to the traditional findViewById approach. This should resolve all the unresolved reference issues. Here's what I changed:

1. **Removed the view binding import and implementation**:
   - Removed `import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.ItemMeetingBinding`
   - Added necessary imports for View, TextView, and ImageButton

2. **Changed the ViewHolder implementation**:
   - Instead of using binding, now using findViewById to get references to the views
   - Explicitly defined each view with its proper type
   - Used R.id references to find the views

3. **Modified the onCreateViewHolder method**:
   - Now inflating the layout directly using LayoutInflater and R.layout.item_meeting
   - Passing the inflated view to the ViewHolder constructor

4. **Updated the bind method**:
   - Now using the direct view references instead of binding.apply
   - Using itemView for the click listener instead of binding.root

This approach is more traditional and should work reliably since it doesn't depend on the view binding configuration. The adapter will now correctly find and use all the views defined in the item_meeting.xml layout.

-                if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.M) {
+                
+                // Check if we can schedule exact alarms on Android S and above
+                if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.S) {
+                    if (alarmManager.canScheduleExactAlarms()) {
+                        alarmManager.setExactAndAllowWhileIdle(
+                            AlarmManager.RTC_WAKEUP,
+                            notification.triggerTime,
+                            pendingIntent
+                        )
+                    } else {
+                        // Fall back to inexact alarm
+                        alarmManager.set(

+                            notification.triggerTime,

+                        )
+                    }
+                } else {

Let's summarize the changes we've made to fix all the issues:

1. **Fixed MeetingAdapter.kt**:
   - Updated the adapter to properly use view binding with the `with(binding)` pattern to access the views.

2. **Fixed NotificationActionReceiver.kt**:
   - Changed the unused parameter `e` to `_` in the catch block.
   - Updated the alarm scheduling code to properly check for `canScheduleExactAlarms()` on Android S and above.

3. **Fixed Repository.kt**:
   - Added the `lastSyncTimestamp` property to both the Meeting and Class data classes.
   - Fixed the typo in "unsynced" by changing the variable names to "unsynchronizedClasses" and "unsynchronizedMeetings".

These changes should resolve all the issues you were experiencing. The app should now compile without errors and work correctly.

Here's a summary of what we did:

1. **View Binding Issues**:
   - Properly implemented view binding in the MeetingAdapter.kt file.

2. **Alarm Manager Issues**:
   - Added proper checks for `canScheduleExactAlarms()` on Android S and above.
   - Improved error handling in the NotificationActionReceiver.

3. **Data Model Issues**:
   - Added the missing `lastSyncTimestamp` property to both data models.
   - Fixed variable naming to avoid typo warnings.

The app should now have a more robust notification system, better data synchronization, and properly functioning UI components.

--- app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/data/remote/FirebaseService.kt.new
+++ app/src/main/java/com/example/teacherscheduler/data/remote/FirebaseService.kt.new
@@ -0,0 +1,178 @@
+package com.example.teacherscheduler.data.remote
+
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.ClassItem
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Meeting
+import com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseAuth
+import com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore
+import com.google.firebase.Timestamp
+import kotlinx.coroutines.tasks.await
+import java.util.Date
+
+class FirebaseService {
+    private val db = FirebaseFirestore.getInstance()
+    private val auth = FirebaseAuth.getInstance()
+    
+    private val userId: String?
+        get() = auth.currentUser?.uid
+    
+    // Authentication
+    suspend fun signIn(email: String, password: String): Boolean {
+        return try {
+            auth.signInWithEmailAndPassword(email, password).await()
+            true
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            false
+        }
+    }
+    
+    suspend fun signUp(email: String, password: String): Boolean {
+        return try {
+            auth.createUserWithEmailAndPassword(email, password).await()
+            true
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            false
+        }
+    }
+    
+    fun signOut() {
+        auth.signOut()
+    }
+    
+    // Cloud operations for Class
+    suspend fun syncClass(classItem: ClassItem): Long {
+        val userId = userId ?: return -1
+        
+        val classMap = hashMapOf(
+            "subject" to classItem.subject,
+            "department" to classItem.department,
+            "roomNumber" to classItem.roomNumber,
+            "startTime" to classItem.startTime,
+            "endTime" to classItem.endTime,
+            "dayOfWeek" to classItem.dayOfWeek,
+            "date" to classItem.date,
+            "daysOfWeek" to classItem.daysOfWeek,
+            "isActive" to classItem.isActive,
+            "notificationEnabled" to classItem.notificationEnabled,
+            "lastSyncTimestamp" to Date().time
+        )
+        
+        return try {
+            if (classItem.id == 0L) {
+                // Create new class
+                val docRef = db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                    .collection("classes").add(classMap).await()
+                docRef.id.hashCode().toLong()
+            } else {
+                // Update existing class
+                db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                    .collection("classes").document(classItem.id.toString())
+                    .set(classMap).await()
+                classItem.id
+            }
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            -1
+        }
+    }
+    
+    suspend fun getClasses(): List<ClassItem> {
+        val userId = userId ?: return emptyList()
+        
+        return try {
+            val snapshot = db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                .collection("classes").get().await()
+            
+            snapshot.documents.mapNotNull { doc ->
+                try {
+                    val data = doc.data ?: return@mapNotNull null
+                    
+                    ClassItem(
+                        id = doc.id.hashCode().toLong(),
+                        subject = data["subject"] as? String ?: "",
+                        department = data["department"] as? String ?: "",
+                        roomNumber = data["roomNumber"] as? String ?: "",
+                        startTime = data["startTime"] as? String ?: "00:00",
+                        endTime = data["endTime"] as? String ?: "00:00",
+                        dayOfWeek = data["dayOfWeek"] as? String ?: "Monday",
+                        date = data["date"] as? String ?: "Jan 01",
+                        daysOfWeek = (data["daysOfWeek"] as? List<*>)?.mapNotNull { it as? Int } ?: listOf(),
+                        isActive = data["isActive"] as? Boolean == true,
+                        notificationEnabled = data["notificationEnabled"] as? Boolean == true,
+                        lastSyncTimestamp = data["lastSyncTimestamp"] as? Long ?: 0
+                    )
+                } catch (_: Exception) {
+                    null
+                }
+            }
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            emptyList()
+        }
+    }
+    
+    // Similar implementation for meetings
+    suspend fun syncMeeting(meeting: Meeting): Long {
+        val userId = userId ?: return -1
+        
+        val meetingMap = hashMapOf(
+            "title" to meeting.title,
+            "withWhom" to meeting.withWhom,
+            "location" to meeting.location,
+            "startTime" to meeting.startTime,
+            "endTime" to meeting.endTime,
+            "dayOfWeek" to meeting.dayOfWeek,
+            "date" to meeting.date,
+            "isActive" to meeting.isActive,
+            "notificationEnabled" to meeting.notificationEnabled,
+            "lastSyncTimestamp" to Date().time
+        )
+        
+        return try {
+            if (meeting.id == 0L) {
+                // Create new meeting
+                val docRef = db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                    .collection("meetings").add(meetingMap).await()
+                docRef.id.hashCode().toLong()
+            } else {
+                // Update existing meeting
+                db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                    .collection("meetings").document(meeting.id.toString())
+                    .set(meetingMap).await()
+                meeting.id
+            }
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            -1
+        }
+    }
+    
+    suspend fun getMeetings(): List<Meeting> {
+        val userId = userId ?: return emptyList()
+        
+        return try {
+            val snapshot = db.collection("users").document(userId)
+                .collection("meetings").get().await()
+            
+            snapshot.documents.mapNotNull { doc ->
+                try {
+                    val data = doc.data ?: return@mapNotNull null
+                    
+                    Meeting(
+                        id = doc.id.hashCode().toLong(),
+                        title = data["title"] as? String ?: "",
+                        withWhom = data["withWhom"] as? String ?: "",
+                        location = data["location"] as? String ?: "",
+                        startTime = data["startTime"] as? String ?: "00:00",
+                        endTime = data["endTime"] as? String ?: "00:00",
+                        dayOfWeek = data["dayOfWeek"] as? String ?: "Monday",
+                        date = data["date"] as? String ?: "Jan 01",
+                        isActive = data["isActive"] as? Boolean == true,
+                        notificationEnabled = data["notificationEnabled"] as? Boolean == true,
+                        lastSyncTimestamp = data["lastSyncTimestamp"] as? Long ?: 0
+                    )
+                } catch (_: Exception) {
+                    null
+                }
+            }
+        } catch (_: Exception) {
+            emptyList()
+        }
+    }
+}

content.text:
Let's summarize the changes we've made to fix all the issues:

1. **Fixed MeetingAdapter.kt and ClassAdapter.kt**:
   - Updated the adapters to use string-based time formatting instead of Date objects
   - Added the necessary imports for the new utility functions

2. **Added String Utility Functions**:
   - Created `formatTime()` extension function for String to format time strings
   - Created `formatTimeRange()` function to format a range of time strings

3. **Updated Repository.kt**:
   - Modified `getClassesForDay()` and `getMeetingsForDay()` to use string-based date formatting
   - Updated the methods to work with the new DAO query methods

4. **Updated DAO Query Methods**:
   - Changed `getClassesForDay()` and `getMeetingsForDay()` to use string date parameters instead of Date objects

5. **Fixed Entity Classes**:
   - Added Room annotations to the Meeting and Class data classes
   - Added the necessary properties for database storage

These changes should resolve all the type mismatch issues and make the app work correctly with string-based time and date handling instead of Date objects.

The app should now compile without errors and function properly with the updated data models and utility functions.

content.text:
I've fixed both issues in the item_meeting.xml file:

1. **Fixed the ampersand issue**:
   - Added a new string resource in strings.xml: `<string name="sample_meeting_with">Dr. Smith & Team</string>`
   - Updated the tools:text attribute to use this string resource: `tools:text="@string/sample_meeting_with"`
   - This approach properly escapes the ampersand in the string resource and avoids XML parsing issues

2. **Fixed the insufficient image color contrast ratio**:
   - Changed the tint color of the delete button from `#FD4242` (a lighter red) to `#FF0000` (a more vibrant red)
   - This increases the contrast ratio, making the button more visible and accessible
   - The higher contrast helps users with visual impairments to better identify the delete button

These changes should resolve both issues:
1. The XML parsing error related to the ampersand
2. The accessibility warning about insufficient color contrast

The app should now compile without these warnings and provide a better user experience, especially for users with visual impairments.

Bundle?) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState) binding = ActivityAddEditClassBinding.inflate(layoutInflater) setContentView(binding.root) setupToolbar() loadClassData() setupDateTimePickers() setupButtons() } private fun setupToolbar() { setSupportActionBar(binding.toolbar) supportActionBar?.setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true) supportActionBar?.setDisplayShowHomeEnabled(true) binding.toolbar.setNavigationOnClickListener { finish() } } private fun loadClassData() { val classId = intent.getLongExtra(EXTRA_CLASS_ID, -1) if (classId != -1L) { editingClass = DataManager.getClassById(classId) editingClass?.let { classItem -> binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Edit Class" populateFields(classItem) binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = true } } else { binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Add Class" binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = false setDefaultDateTime() } } private fun populateFields(classItem: Class) { binding.editSubject.setText(classItem.subject) binding.editDepartment.setText(classItem.department) binding.editRoomNumber.setText(classItem.roomNumber) binding.checkboxRecurring.isChecked = classItem.isRecurring // Parse stored date/time strings and update UI updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setDefaultDateTime() { // Set default to current date and time val now = Calendar.getInstance() startDate.time = now.time endDate.time = now.time startTime.time = now.time endTime.add(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 1) // Default 1 hour duration updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setupDateTimePickers() { // Start Date Picker binding.buttonStartDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> startDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), startDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), startDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } // Start Time Picker binding.buttonStartTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> startTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) startTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), startTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } // End Date Picker binding.buttonEndDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> endDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), endDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), endDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } // End Time Picker binding.buttonEndTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> endTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) endTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), endTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } } private fun updateDateTimeDisplays() { val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("EEE, MMM dd, yyyy", Locale.getDefault()) val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.getDefault()) binding.buttonStartDate.text = dateFormat.format(startDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonStartTime.text = timeFormat.format(startTime.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndDate.text = dateFormat.format(endDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndTime.text = timeFormat.format(endTime.time).uppercase() } private fun setupButtons() { binding.buttonSave.setOnClickListener { saveClass() } binding.buttonCancel.setOnClickListener { finish() } binding.buttonDelete.setOnClickListener { showDeleteConfirmation() } } private fun saveClass() { val subject = binding.editSubject.text.toString().trim() val department = binding.editDepartment.text.toString().trim() val roomNumber = binding.editRoomNumber.text.toString().trim() if (subject.isEmpty() || department.isEmpty() || roomNumber.isEmpty()) { Toast.makeText(this, "Please fill all required fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() return } val classItem = Class( id = editingClass?.id ?: 0, subject = subject, department = department, roomNumber = roomNumber, startDate = startDate.time, endDate = endDate.time, startTime = startTime.time, endTime = endTime.time, isRecurring = binding.checkboxRecurring.isChecked ) if (editingClass != null) { DataManager.updateClass(classItem) Toast.makeText(this, "Class updated successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } else { DataManager.addClass(classItem) Toast.makeText(this, "Class added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } private fun showDeleteConfirmation() { editingClass?.let { classItem -> AlertDialog.Builder(this) .setTitle("Delete Class") .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${classItem.subject}?") .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ -> DataManager.deleteClass(classItem.id) Toast.makeText(this, "Class deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null) .show() } } }

+package com.example.teacherscheduler.ui
+
+import android.app.DatePickerDialog
+import android.app.TimePickerDialog
+import android.content.Context
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.View
+import android.widget.Toast
+import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog
+import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.R
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.data.DataManager
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.ActivityAddEditClassBinding
+import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Class
+import com.google.android.material.chip.Chip
+import java.text.SimpleDateFormat
+import java.util.*
+
+class AddEditClassActivity : AppCompatActivity() {
+    private lateinit var binding: ActivityAddEditClassBinding
+    private var editingClass: Class? = null
+    private var startDate = Calendar.getInstance()
+    private var endDate = Calendar.getInstance()
+    private var startTime = Calendar.getInstance()
+    private var endTime = Calendar.getInstance()
+    private val selectedDays = mutableListOf<Int>()
+
+    companion object {
+        const val EXTRA_CLASS_ID = "extra_class_id"
+        
+        fun newIntent(context: Context, classId: Long? = null): Intent {
+            return Intent(context, AddEditClassActivity::class.java).apply {
+                classId?.let { putExtra(EXTRA_CLASS_ID, it) }
+            }
+        }
+    }
+
+    override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
+        binding = ActivityAddEditClassBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
+        setContentView(binding.root)
+        
+        setupToolbar()
+        setupDaysOfWeekChips()
+        setupRecurringCheckbox()
+        loadClassData()
+        setupDateTimePickers()
+        setupButtons()
+    }
+
+    private fun setupToolbar() {
+        setSupportActionBar(binding.toolbar)
+        supportActionBar?.setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true)
+        supportActionBar?.setDisplayShowHomeEnabled(true)
+        binding.toolbar.setNavigationOnClickListener { finish() }
+    }
+
+    private fun setupDaysOfWeekChips() {
+        val chips = listOf(
+            binding.chipMonday to Calendar.MONDAY,
+            binding.chipTuesday to Calendar.TUESDAY,
+            binding.chipWednesday to Calendar.WEDNESDAY,
+            binding.chipThursday to Calendar.THURSDAY,
+            binding.chipFriday to Calendar.FRIDAY,
+            binding.chipSaturday to Calendar.SATURDAY,
+            binding.chipSunday to Calendar.SUNDAY
+        )
+        
+        chips.forEach { (chip, dayValue) ->
+            chip.setOnCheckedChangeListener { _, isChecked ->
+                if (isChecked) {
+                    if (!selectedDays.contains(dayValue)) {
+                        selectedDays.add(dayValue)
+                    }
+                } else {
+                    selectedDays.remove(dayValue)
+                }
+            }
+        }
+    }
+    
+    private fun setupRecurringCheckbox() {
+        binding.checkboxRecurring.setOnCheckedChangeListener { _, isChecked ->
+            binding.layoutDaysOfWeek.visibility = if (isChecked) View.VISIBLE else View.GONE
+        }
+        
+        // Initially hide days of week selection
+        binding.layoutDaysOfWeek.visibility = View.GONE
+    }
+
+    private fun loadClassData() {
+        val classId = intent.getLongExtra(EXTRA_CLASS_ID, -1)
+        if (classId != -1L) {
+            // Find the class by ID
+            val foundClass = DataManager.getAllClasses().find { it.id == classId }
+            
+            if (foundClass != null) {
+                editingClass = foundClass
+                binding.toolbarTitle.text = getString(R.string.edit_class)
+                populateFields(foundClass)
+                binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = true
+            } else {
+                // Class not found, treat as new class
+                binding.toolbarTitle.text = getString(R.string.add_class)
+                binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = false
+                setDefaultDateTime()
+            }
+        } else {
+            // Adding a new class
+            binding.toolbarTitle.text = getString(R.string.add_class)
+            binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = false
+            setDefaultDateTime()
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun populateFields(classItem: Class) {
+        binding.editSubject.setText(classItem.subject)
+        binding.editDepartment.setText(classItem.department)
+        binding.editRoomNumber.setText(classItem.roomNumber)
+        
+        // Parse time strings
+        parseTimeStrings(classItem.startTime, classItem.endTime)
+        
+        // Set date from the class item
+        val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("MMM dd", Locale.US)
+        try {
+            val date = dateFormat.parse(classItem.date)
+            if (date != null) {
+                val calendar = Calendar.getInstance()
+                calendar.time = date
+                startDate.set(Calendar.MONTH, calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH))
+                startDate.set(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH, calendar.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH))
+                endDate.set(Calendar.MONTH, calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH))
+                endDate.set(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH, calendar.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH))
+            }
+        } catch (e: Exception) {
+            // If parsing fails, keep the default date
+        }
+        
+        // Set recurring and days of week
+        val isRecurring = classItem.daysOfWeek.isNotEmpty()
+        binding.checkboxRecurring.isChecked = isRecurring
+        binding.layoutDaysOfWeek.visibility = if (isRecurring) View.VISIBLE else View.GONE
+        
+        // Set selected days
+        selectedDays.clear()
+        selectedDays.addAll(classItem.daysOfWeek)
+        
+        // Update chip states
+        updateDayChips()
+        
+        // Set notification state
+        binding.switchNotifications.isChecked = classItem.notificationEnabled
+        
+        // Update UI displays
+        updateDateTimeDisplays()
+    }
+    
+    private fun parseTimeStrings(startTimeStr: String, endTimeStr: String) {
+        val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.US)
+        
+        try {
+            val parsedStartTime = timeFormat.parse(startTimeStr)
+            if (parsedStartTime != null) {
+                startTime.time = parsedStartTime
+            }
+        } catch (e: Exception) {
+            // If parsing fails, keep the default time
+        }
+        
+        try {
+            val parsedEndTime = timeFormat.parse(endTimeStr)
+            if (parsedEndTime != null) {
+                endTime.time = parsedEndTime
+            }
+        } catch (e: Exception) {
+            // If parsing fails, keep the default time
+        }
+    }
+    
+    private fun updateDayChips() {
+        val chipMap = mapOf(
+            Calendar.MONDAY to binding.chipMonday,
+            Calendar.TUESDAY to binding.chipTuesday,
+            Calendar.WEDNESDAY to binding.chipWednesday,
+            Calendar.THURSDAY to binding.chipThursday,
+            Calendar.FRIDAY to binding.chipFriday,
+            Calendar.SATURDAY to binding.chipSaturday,
+            Calendar.SUNDAY to binding.chipSunday
+        )
+        
+        // Reset all chips
+        chipMap.values.forEach { it.isChecked = false }
+        
+        // Set selected chips
+        selectedDays.forEach { day ->
+            chipMap[day]?.isChecked = true
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun setDefaultDateTime() {
+        // Set default to current date and time
+        val now = Calendar.getInstance()
+        startDate.time = now.time
+        endDate.time = now.time
+        
+        // Set start time to nearest hour
+        startTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0)
+        startTime.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)
+        startTime.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)
+        
+        // Set end time to 1 hour after start
+        endTime.time = startTime.time
+        endTime.add(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 1)
+        
+        updateDateTimeDisplays()
+    }
+
+    private fun setupDateTimePickers() {
+        // Start Date Picker
+        binding.buttonStartDate.setOnClickListener {
+            DatePickerDialog(
+                this,
+                { _, year, month, day ->
+                    startDate.set(year, month, day)
+                    updateDateTimeDisplays()
+                },
+                startDate.get(Calendar.YEAR),
+                startDate.get(Calendar.MONTH),
+                startDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)
+            ).show()
+        }
+
+        // Start Time Picker
+        binding.buttonStartTime.setOnClickListener {
+            TimePickerDialog(
+                this,
+                { _, hour, minute ->
+                    startTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour)
+                    startTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute)
+                    updateDateTimeDisplays()
+                },
+                startTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY),
+                startTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE),
+                false
+            ).show()
+        }
+
+        // End Date Picker
+        binding.buttonEndDate.setOnClickListener {
+            DatePickerDialog(
+                this,
+                { _, year, month, day ->
+                    endDate.set(year, month, day)
+                    updateDateTimeDisplays()
+                },
+                endDate.get(Calendar.YEAR),
+                endDate.get(Calendar.MONTH),
+                endDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)
+            ).show()
+        }
+
+        // End Time Picker
+        binding.buttonEndTime.setOnClickListener {
+            TimePickerDialog(
+                this,
+                { _, hour, minute ->
+                    endTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour)
+                    endTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute)
+                    updateDateTimeDisplays()
+                },
+                endTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY),
+                endTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE),
+                false
+            ).show()
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun updateDateTimeDisplays() {
+        val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("EEE, MMM dd, yyyy", Locale.getDefault())
+        val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.getDefault())
+        
+        binding.buttonStartDate.text = dateFormat.format(startDate.time).uppercase()
+        binding.buttonStartTime.text = timeFormat.format(startTime.time).uppercase()
+        binding.buttonEndDate.text = dateFormat.format(endDate.time).uppercase()
+        binding.buttonEndTime.text = timeFormat.format(endTime.time).uppercase()
+    }
+
+    private fun setupButtons() {
+        binding.buttonSave.setOnClickListener {
+            saveClass()
+        }
+        
+        binding.buttonCancel.setOnClickListener {
+            finish()
+        }
+        
+        binding.buttonDelete.setOnClickListener {
+            showDeleteConfirmation()
+        }
+    }
+
+    private fun saveClass() {
+        val subject = binding.editSubject.text.toString().trim()
+        val department = binding.editDepartment.text.toString().trim()
+        val roomNumber = binding.editRoomNumber.text.toString().trim()
+        
+        if (subject.isEmpty() || department.isEmpty() || roomNumber.isEmpty()) {
+            Toast.makeText(this, "Please fill all required fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+            return
+        }
+        
+        // Format date and time strings
+        val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("MMM dd", Locale.US)
+        val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.US)
+        val dayFormat = SimpleDateFormat("EEE", Locale.US)
+        
+        val date = dateFormat.format(startDate.time)
+        val startTimeStr = timeFormat.format(startTime.time)
+        val endTimeStr = timeFormat.format(endTime.time)
+        val dayOfWeek = dayFormat.format(startDate.time)
+        
+        // Get days of week if recurring
+        val daysOfWeek = if (binding.checkboxRecurring.isChecked) selectedDays.toList() else listOf()
+        
+        val classItem = Class(
+            id = editingClass?.id ?: 0,
+            subject = subject,
+            department = department,
+            roomNumber = roomNumber,
+            startTime = startTimeStr,
+            endTime = endTimeStr,
+            dayOfWeek = dayOfWeek,
+            date = date,
+            isActive = true,
+            notificationEnabled = binding.switchNotifications.isChecked,
+            daysOfWeek = daysOfWeek
+        )
+        
+        if (editingClass != null) {
+            DataManager.updateClass(classItem)
+            Toast.makeText(this, "Class updated successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+        } else {
+            DataManager.addClass(classItem)
+            Toast.makeText(this, "Class added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+        }
+        
+        setResult(RESULT_OK)
+        finish()
+    }
+
+    private fun showDeleteConfirmation() {
+        editingClass?.let { classItem ->
+            AlertDialog.Builder(this)
+                .setTitle("Delete Class")
+                .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${classItem.subject}?")
+                .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ ->
+                    DataManager.deleteClass(classItem.id)
+                    Toast.makeText(this, "Class deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
+                    setResult(RESULT_OK)
+                    finish()
+                }
+                .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null)
+                .show()
+        }
+    }
+}

content.text:
I've successfully implemented the AddEditClassActivity for the Teacher Scheduler app. Here's a summary of what I've done:

1. **Created the Layout File (activity_add_edit_class.xml)**:
   - Designed a professional form layout with Material Design components
   - Included fields for subject, department, room number
   - Added date and time pickers for class schedule
   - Implemented recurring class option with day-of-week selection chips
   - Added notification toggle and action buttons (save, cancel, delete)

2. **Added String Resources**:
   - Added all necessary string resources for labels, buttons, and hints
   - Created abbreviated day names for the day-of-week chips

3. **Added Color Resources**:
   - Created a chip background color for the day selection chips

4. **Implemented the Activity (AddEditClassActivity.kt)**:
   - Created the activity with proper data binding
   - Implemented date and time pickers with proper formatting
   - Added support for editing existing classes or creating new ones
   - Implemented day-of-week selection for recurring classes
   - Added validation for required fields
   - Implemented save, cancel, and delete functionality

5. **Updated the AndroidManifest.xml**:
   - Added the new activity to the manifest
   - Set proper parent activity for back navigation
   - Configured soft input mode for better keyboard handling

The implementation follows best practices:
- Uses view binding for type-safe view access
- Implements proper date and time formatting
- Handles both new class creation and editing existing classes
- Provides user-friendly validation and feedback
- Uses Material Design components for a modern UI
- Supports proper navigation with up button in the toolbar

This activity provides a complete interface for teachers to add or edit classes with all necessary details, including scheduling information and notification preferences.

      binding.buttonCancel.setOnClickListener %7B%0A            finish()%0A        %7D%0A        %0A        binding.buttonDelete.setOnClickListener %7B%0A            showDeleteConfirmation()%0A        %7D%0A    %7D%0A%0A    private fun saveClass() %7B%0A        val subject = binding.editSubject.text.toString().trim()%0A        val department = binding.editDepartment.text.toString().trim()%0A        val roomNumber = binding.editRoomNumber.text.toString().trim()%0A        %0A        if (subject.isEmpty() %7C%7C department.isEmpty() %7C%7C roomNumber.isEmpty()) %7B%0A            Toast.makeText(this, %22Please fill all required fields%22, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()%0A            return%0A        %7D%0A        %0A        // Format date and time strings%0A        val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat(%22MMM dd%22, Locale.US)%0A        val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat(%22hh:mm a%22, Locale.US)%0A        val dayFormat = SimpleDateFormat(%22EEE%22, Locale.US)%0A        %0A        val date = dateFormat.format(startDate.time)%0A        val startTimeStr = timeFormat.format(startTime.time)%0A        val endTimeStr = timeFormat.format(endTime.time)%0A        val dayOfWeek = dayFormat.format(startDate.time)%0A        %0A        // Get days of week if recurring%0A        val daysOfWeek = if (binding.checkboxRecurring.isChecked) selectedDays.toList() else listOf()%0A        %0A        val classItem = Class(%0A            id = editingClass?.id ?: 0,%0A            subject = subject,%0A            department = department,%0A            roomNumber = roomNumber,%0A            startTime = startTimeStr,%0A            endTime = endTimeStr,%0A            dayOfWeek = dayOfWeek,%0A            date = date,%0A            isActive = true,%0A            notificationEnabled = binding.switchNotifications.isChecked,%0A            daysOfWeek = daysOfWeek%0A        )%0A        %0A        if (editingClass != null) %7B%0A            DataManager.updateClass(classItem)%0A            Toast.makeText(this, %22Class updated successfully!%22, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()%0A        %7D else %7B%0A            DataManager.addClass(classItem)%0A            Toast.makeText(this, %22Class added successfully!%22, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()%0A        %7D%0A        %0A        setResult(RESULT_OK)%0A        finish()%0A    %7D%0A%0A    private fun showDeleteConfirmation() %7B%0A        editingClass?.let %7B classItem -%3E%0A            AlertDialog.Builder(this)%0A                .setTitle(%22Delete Class%22)%0A                .setMessage(%22Are you sure you want to delete $%7BclassItem.subject%7D?%22)%0A                .setPositiveButton(%22Delete%22) %7B _, _ -%3E%0A                    DataManager.deleteClass(classItem.id)%0A                    Toast.makeText(this, %22Class deleted%22, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()%0A                    setResult(RESULT_OK)%0A                    finish()%0A                %7D%0A                .setNegativeButton(%22Cancel%22, null)%0A                .show()%0A        %7D%0A    %7D%0A%7D

content.text: package com.example.teacherscheduler.ui import android.app.DatePickerDialog import android.app.TimePickerDialog import android.content.Context import android.content.Intent import android.os.Bundle import android.widget.Toast import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity import com.example.teacherscheduler.data.DataManager import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Meeting import java.text.SimpleDateFormat import java.util.* class AddEditMeetingActivity : AppCompatActivity() { private lateinit var binding: ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding private var editingMeeting: Meeting? = null private var startDate = Calendar.getInstance() private var endDate = Calendar.getInstance() private var startTime = Calendar.getInstance() private var endTime = Calendar.getInstance() companion object { const val EXTRA_MEETING_ID = "extra_meeting_id" fun newIntent(context: Context, meetingId: Long? = null): Intent { return Intent(context, AddEditMeetingActivity::class.java).apply { meetingId?.let { putExtra(EXTRA_MEETING_ID, it) } } } } override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState) binding = ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding.inflate(layoutInflater) setContentView(binding.root) setupToolbar() loadMeetingData() setupDateTimePickers() setupButtons() } private fun setupToolbar() { setSupportActionBar(binding.toolbar) supportActionBar?.setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true) supportActionBar?.setDisplayShowHomeEnabled(true) binding.toolbar.setNavigationOnClickListener { finish() } } private fun loadMeetingData() { val meetingId = intent.getLongExtra(EXTRA_MEETING_ID, -1) if (meetingId != -1L) { editingMeeting = DataManager.getMeetingById(meetingId) editingMeeting?.let { meeting -> binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Edit Meeting" populateFields(meeting) binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = true } } else { binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Add Meeting" binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = false setDefaultDateTime() } } private fun populateFields(meeting: Meeting) { binding.editTitle.setText(meeting.title) binding.editWithWhom.setText(meeting.withWhom) binding.editLocation.setText(meeting.location) binding.editNotes.setText(meeting.notes) updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setDefaultDateTime() { val now = Calendar.getInstance() startDate.time = now.time endDate.time = now.time startTime.time = now.time endTime.add(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 1) updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setupDateTimePickers() { binding.buttonStartDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> startDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), startDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), startDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } binding.buttonStartTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> startTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) startTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), startTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } binding.buttonEndDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> endDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), endDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), endDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } binding.buttonEndTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> endTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) endTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), endTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } } private fun updateDateTimeDisplays() { val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("EEE, MMM dd, yyyy", Locale.getDefault()) val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.getDefault()) binding.buttonStartDate.text = dateFormat.format(startDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonStartTime.text = timeFormat.format(startTime.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndDate.text = dateFormat.format(endDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndTime.text = timeFormat.format(endTime.time).uppercase() } private fun setupButtons() { binding.buttonSave.setOnClickListener { saveMeeting() } binding.buttonCancel.setOnClickListener { finish() } binding.buttonDelete.setOnClickListener { showDeleteConfirmation() } } private fun saveMeeting() { val title = binding.editTitle.text.toString().trim() val withWhom = binding.editWithWhom.text.toString().trim() val location = binding.editLocation.text.toString().trim() val notes = binding.editNotes.text.toString().trim() if (title.isEmpty() || withWhom.isEmpty()) { Toast.makeText(this, "Please fill required fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() return } val meeting = Meeting( id = editingMeeting?.id ?: 0, title = title, withWhom = withWhom, location = location, notes = notes, startDate = startDate.time, endDate = endDate.time, startTime = startTime.time, endTime = endTime.time ) if (editingMeeting != null) { DataManager.updateMeeting(meeting) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting updated successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } else { DataManager.addMeeting(meeting) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } private fun showDeleteConfirmation() { editingMeeting?.let { meeting -> AlertDialog.Builder(this) .setTitle("Delete Meeting") .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${meeting.title}?") .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ -> DataManager.deleteMeeting(meeting.id) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null) .show() } } }

package com.example.teacherscheduler.ui import android.app.DatePickerDialog import android.app.TimePickerDialog import android.content.Context import android.content.Intent import android.os.Bundle import android.widget.Toast import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity import com.example.teacherscheduler.data.DataManager import com.example.teacherscheduler.databinding.ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding import com.example.teacherscheduler.model.Meeting import java.text.SimpleDateFormat import java.util.* class AddEditMeetingActivity : AppCompatActivity() { private lateinit var binding: ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding private var editingMeeting: Meeting? = null private var startDate = Calendar.getInstance() private var endDate = Calendar.getInstance() private var startTime = Calendar.getInstance() private var endTime = Calendar.getInstance() companion object { const val EXTRA_MEETING_ID = "extra_meeting_id" fun newIntent(context: Context, meetingId: Long? = null): Intent { return Intent(context, AddEditMeetingActivity::class.java).apply { meetingId?.let { putExtra(EXTRA_MEETING_ID, it) } } } } override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) { super.onCreate(savedInstanceState) binding = ActivityAddEditMeetingBinding.inflate(layoutInflater) setContentView(binding.root) setupToolbar() loadMeetingData() setupDateTimePickers() setupButtons() } private fun setupToolbar() { setSupportActionBar(binding.toolbar) supportActionBar?.setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true) supportActionBar?.setDisplayShowHomeEnabled(true) binding.toolbar.setNavigationOnClickListener { finish() } } private fun loadMeetingData() { val meetingId = intent.getLongExtra(EXTRA_MEETING_ID, -1) if (meetingId != -1L) { editingMeeting = DataManager.getMeetingById(meetingId) editingMeeting?.let { meeting -> binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Edit Meeting" populateFields(meeting) binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = true } } else { binding.toolbarTitle.text = "Add Meeting" binding.buttonDelete.isEnabled = false setDefaultDateTime() } } private fun populateFields(meeting: Meeting) { binding.editTitle.setText(meeting.title) binding.editWithWhom.setText(meeting.withWhom) binding.editLocation.setText(meeting.location) binding.editNotes.setText(meeting.notes) updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setDefaultDateTime() { val now = Calendar.getInstance() startDate.time = now.time endDate.time = now.time startTime.time = now.time endTime.add(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 1) updateDateTimeDisplays() } private fun setupDateTimePickers() { binding.buttonStartDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> startDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), startDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), startDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } binding.buttonStartTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> startTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) startTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, startTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), startTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } binding.buttonEndDate.setOnClickListener { DatePickerDialog( this, { _, year, month, day -> endDate.set(year, month, day) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endDate.get(Calendar.YEAR), endDate.get(Calendar.MONTH), endDate.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) ).show() } binding.buttonEndTime.setOnClickListener { TimePickerDialog( this, { _, hour, minute -> endTime.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, hour) endTime.set(Calendar.MINUTE, minute) updateDateTimeDisplays() }, endTime.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY), endTime.get(Calendar.MINUTE), false ).show() } } private fun updateDateTimeDisplays() { val dateFormat = SimpleDateFormat("EEE, MMM dd, yyyy", Locale.getDefault()) val timeFormat = SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm a", Locale.getDefault()) binding.buttonStartDate.text = dateFormat.format(startDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonStartTime.text = timeFormat.format(startTime.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndDate.text = dateFormat.format(endDate.time).uppercase() binding.buttonEndTime.text = timeFormat.format(endTime.time).uppercase() } private fun setupButtons() { binding.buttonSave.setOnClickListener { saveMeeting() } binding.buttonCancel.setOnClickListener { finish() } binding.buttonDelete.setOnClickListener { showDeleteConfirmation() } } private fun saveMeeting() { val title = binding.editTitle.text.toString().trim() val withWhom = binding.editWithWhom.text.toString().trim() val location = binding.editLocation.text.toString().trim() val notes = binding.editNotes.text.toString().trim() if (title.isEmpty() || withWhom.isEmpty()) { Toast.makeText(this, "Please fill required fields", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() return } val meeting = Meeting( id = editingMeeting?.id ?: 0, title = title, withWhom = withWhom, location = location, notes = notes, startDate = startDate.time, endDate = endDate.time, startTime = startTime.time, endTime = endTime.time ) if (editingMeeting != null) { DataManager.updateMeeting(meeting) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting updated successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } else { DataManager.addMeeting(meeting) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting added successfully!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() } setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } private fun showDeleteConfirmation() { editingMeeting?.let { meeting -> AlertDialog.Builder(this) .setTitle("Delete Meeting") .setMessage("Are you sure you want to delete ${meeting.title}?") .setPositiveButton("Delete") { _, _ -> DataManager.deleteMeeting(meeting.id) Toast.makeText(this, "Meeting deleted", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show() setResult(RESULT_OK) finish() } .setNegativeButton("Cancel", null) .show() } } }
